page.title: 13HOUSING:DRAYTON BASSETT
page.content: The village of Drayton Bassett is divided into 3 main areas: Area 1 as you enter the village along Drayton lane consists of large detached houses. Area 2 the centre of the village: old cottages dating from the 18th century- 19th century, including Peel estate cottages and converted blacksmith's forge with some terraced and semi-detached houses. Area 3 west of church, mainly council houses or small semi-detached; these and the houses in Area 1 have been built over the last 25 years showing a rapid rise in population. Altogether there are 245 houses in the village: 33 detached (valued at 60-75,000 pounds), 176 semi-detached (25,000+ pounds), and various bungalows and terraced houses. The housing and gardens are well maintained.
